description: The Indian Church, which claims the apostle Thomas as its founder, is the "home base" for this
historical exploration of Christianity from the apostolic age to the present. The course considers
Christian teachings about God and Jesus, biblical interpretation, worship, response
to social, political, and cultural practices through encounters between Indian Christians and other
churches. The multiple religions of India, its colonial experience, and its contemporary society are
fullname: Jesus on the Indian Road: A Perspective on Christianity
